title: Seblak
description: Seblak is a savory, spicy Indonesian street food made from softened tapioca crackers cooked with aromatic spices, vegetables, and egg. This is a quick, flexible version — add protein (sausage or shredded chicken) if you like.
instructions: Soak the tapioca crackers in boiling water for 2–3 minutes until slightly softened, then drain and set aside.
Pound or blend the garlic, shallots, bird's eye chilies, and kencur into a coarse paste.
Heat oil in a skillet and sauté the spice paste until fragrant and cooked (about 1–2 minutes).
Add the vegetables and optional protein (sausage/chicken) and stir-fry until the vegetables are wilted.
Add the softened crackers and toss to combine with the spices.
Pour in the beaten egg and quickly stir until the egg is cooked and coats the ingredients.
Season with sweet soy sauce, salt, sugar, and bouillon powder if using. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Cook for 2–3 minutes until everything is well combined and reaches the desired texture, then remove from heat.
Serve hot topped with sliced scallions and a squeeze of lime if desired.
